column4: Can compiling a custom kernel increase the overall speed of ubuntu?
by a few ms at boot, maybe.
put it this way, the speed difference will not offset the amount of time spent trying to compile one.
unless you use your computer for a few thousand years
surprisingly long. not to mention the amount of times you will mess it up, and read docs
there are ways to make it more responsive than ripping the engine out
what speed CPU do you have?
about 3 hrs id say + 3 or so hours making it compile correctly
there are alot of performance settings that might be disabled
hdparm
its a tool that shows that paramaters, like DMA are set on a particular drive
have you got prelinking turned on?
prelinking is not needed in feisty, sorry
make a cup of coffee, walk around the block, make another cup of coffee, have a nap, and it might be 50% done
yep
~30 mins if youre lucky
um what are you compiling in there before you melt your cpu?
good luck. btw custom kernel problems shouldnt be reported to launchpad, obviously
just to be certain, make an average of how fast firefox loads with 'time firefox' then test it out after you have compiled your new kernel
Will do thanks for the tip
